content: The "Weekend Voting Act" establishes Saturday and Sunday as the days for congressional and presidential elections, changing the current election days to increase voter accessibility. Polling place hours will also be adjusted accordingly. The "Weekend Voting Act" changes election days to Saturday and Sunday for congressional and presidential elections, increasing voter accessibility. Polling place hours will be adjusted accordingly for the Presidential general election. The "Weekend Voting Act" shifts election days to Saturday and Sunday for congressional and presidential elections, enhancing voter accessibility. Polling places will be open from 10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. EST for the Presidential general election, and from 10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. local time for locations outside the continental United States. Additionally, polling places may close between 10:00 p.m. and 6:00 a.m. based on state law. The bill proposes to shift election days to Saturday and Sunday, with polling places open from 10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. EST for the Presidential general election. The bill proposes to change election days to Saturday and Sunday, with polling places open from 10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. EST for the Presidential general election. SEC. 25 addresses polling place hours. In this section, definitions are provided for "continental United States" and "congressional general election." Polling places in the continental United States must be open from Saturday at 10:00 a.m. EST to Sunday at 6:00 p.m. EST for congressional general elections. Polling places outside the continental United States have specific opening and closing times for congressional general elections. Early closing is allowed between certain hours as per state law. Amendments are made to the table of sections for chapter 1 of title 3, United States Code. SEC. 5. SENSE OF CONGRESS REGARDING TRANSITION TO WEEKEND VOTING. Congress urges State and local election officials to collaborate with the Election Assistance Commission to plan for a smooth transition to weekend voting for Federal elections.
